alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:03PM CDT until July 14 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL JACKSON...SOUTHWESTERN DUBUQUE...NORTHERN JONES AND SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 403 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Cascade, or 16 miles northeast of Anamosa, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Monticello, Cascade, Hopkinton, Camp Courageous, Jones County Fairgrounds, Fillmore, Pictured Rocks Wildlife Area, Temple Hill, Fillmore Recreation Area and Monticello Municipal Airport. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
